data.title: All Elements and Status Ailments
data.meta_description: Kemono in Wild Hearts are classified by their element which dictates the type of damage they deal and what status ailments they can inflict. Read on to know more about all the elements and status ailments in the game, as well as a complete chart of all Kemono elemental weaknesses to prepare yourself for your next hunt!
data.meta_site_name: Game8｜The Top Gaming and App Walkthroughs Straight from Japan!
data.text:
Kemono in Wild Hearts are classified by their element which dictates the type of damage they deal and what status ailments they can inflict. Read on to know more about all the elements and status ailments in the game, as well as a complete chart of all Kemono elemental weaknesses to prepare yourself for your next hunt!

All Elements and Status Ailments

All Elemental Attributes

Attributes Wood Fire Water Wind Earth

There are a total of 5 different elemental attributes in Wild Hearts. They appear in a variety of stats including armor resiliences, weapon damage types, and kemono weaknesses. When preparing for a hunt, make sure to bring the appropriate armor and weapon to both defend against a kemono's attacks and exploit its elemental weaknesses.

All Status Ailments

Status Ailment Effect How to Heal Related Kemono Poison Inflicts a poison DoT (damage-over-time). Poison will go away after a while. ・Fumebeak

・Venomglider Ablaze Inflicts a burn DoT (damage-over-time). Recover by dodging or by running into water. ・Lavaback

・Cobalt Lavaback

・Emberplume Fatigued Inflicts sleep, preventing players from moving until it wears off. Fatigue will recover over time or when hit by an attack. ・Sporetail

・Ripclaw Frozen Reduces stamina regen. The status ailment will recover over time. ・Icetusk

・Deathstalker Entangled You will not be able to create Karakuri, although you will still be able to use existing ones. This status ailment will recover over time. ・Amaterasu

・Celestial Dragon

Status Ailments are long-lasting effects from a Kemono's attacks. For example, attacks from Lavaback that can set players ablaze while the Deathstalker can reduce stamina regen by triggering a Frozen effect.

There are different ways to heal status ailments from simply waiting to jumping into water. Some armor can even have effects that nullify specific status ailments.

List of All Armor Sets

All Kemono Elemental Weaknesses

NOTE: The elemental weakenesses listed below are the ones that rate the highest against each kemono. The higher the number of stars (★), the more effective that element is when used against them.

All Kemono Elemental Weaknesses Ragetail Fire (4★) Sapscourge Fire (4★) Kingtusk Fire (4★) Spineglider Fire or Wood (4★) Dreadclaw Fire (4★) Gritdog Wind (5★) Lavaback Water (3★) Earthbreaker Wind (5★) Sporetail Fire (4★) Goldshard Wood or Wind (4★) Fumebeak Earth (4★) Icetusk Fire (4★) Cobalt Lavaback Water (3★) Deathstalker Fire (3★) Onyxshard Wood or Wind (4★) Pearlbeak Earth (4★) Venomglider Fire or Wood (4★) Ripclaw Fire, Wood, Earth (3★) Amaterasu Wind (4★) Emberplume Water or Earth (4★) Golden Tempest Fire or Earth (3★) Celestial Dragon All Elements (5★)
